element.name: Message type
element.desc: Type of message being transmitted

element.name: Document/message name
element.desc: Plain language identifier specifying the function of a document/message.

value.name: Mailbox listing generated by NLMAIL command
Postbox listing generated by NLPOST command

element.name: Document/message name coded
element.desc: Document/message identifier expressed in code.

value.name: NLMAIL
value.desc: Network List Mailbox Command

value.name: NLPOST
value.desc: Network List Postbox Command

value.name: NRECEIVE
value.desc: Network Receive Files(s) Command

value.name: NDELETE
value.desc: Network Delete File(s) Command

value.name: NAUTODEL
value.desc: Network Auto-delete Files Command

value.name: NCPASS
value.desc: Network Change Password Command

value.name: SESSACK
value.desc: Network session acknowledgement

value.name: MAILACK
value.desc: Mailbox listing generated by NLMAIL command

value.name: POSTACK
value.desc: Postbox listing generated by NLPOST command

element.name: DOCUMENT/MESSAGE NUMBER
element.desc: Reference number assigned to the document/message by the issuer.

element.name: Code list qualifier
element.desc: Identification of a code list.

element.name: MESSAGE FUNCTION, CODED
element.desc: Code indicating the function of the message.

element.name: Code list responsible agency, coded
element.desc: Code identifying the agency responsible for a code list.

element.name: RESPONSE TYPE, CODED
element.desc: Code specifying the type of acknowledgment required.

value.name: Functional Group Trailer Message Count wrong
Start envelope with no end envelope
File deleted by recipient before extraction
Accepted by Network, but not yet delivered
Purged by Network before recipient extraction

composite.name: DOCUMENT/MESSAGE NAME
composite.desc: Identification of a type of document/message by code or name. Code preferred.

segment.name: BEGINNING OF MESSAGE
segment.desc: To indicate the type and function of a message and to transmit the identifying number.

element.name: Syntax identifier
element.desc: a3 upper case Controlling Agency (e.g. UNO=UN/ECE) and a1 stating level (e.g. A) (which together give UNOA)

value.name: UN/ECE level A
value.desc: As defined in the basic code table of ISO 646 with the exceptions of lower case letters, alternative graphic character allocations and national or application- oriented graphic character allocations.

value.name: UN/ECE level B
value.desc: As defined in the basic code table of ISO 646 with the exceptions of alternative graphic character allocations and national or application-oriented graphic character allocations.

value.name: UN/ECE level C
value.desc: As defined in ISO 8859-1 : Information processing - Part 1: Latin alphabet No. 1.

value.name: UN/ECE level D
value.desc: As defined in ISO 8859-2 : Information processing - Part 2: Latin alphabet No. 2.

value.name: UN/ECE level E
value.desc: As defined in ISO 8859-5 : Information processing - Part 5: Latin/Cyrillic alphabet.

value.name: UN/ECE level F
value.desc: As defined in ISO 8859-7 : Information processing - Part 7: Latin/Greek alphabet.

element.name: Syntax version number
element.desc: Increments 1 for each new version.

element.name: Sender identification
element.desc: Code or name as specified in IA

element.name: Partner identification code qualifier
element.desc: Used with sender/recipient identification code

value.name: DUNS (Dun + Bradstreet)

value.desc: Self explanatory.

value.name: UCC Communications ID (Uniform Code Council Communications
value.desc: Identifier) The Uniform Code Council Communications Identifier is a ten digit code used to uniquely identify physical and logical locations.

value.name: DUNS (Dun + Bradstreet) with 4 digit suffix
value.desc: Self explanatory.

value.desc: Self explanatory.

value.desc: Self explanatory.

value.name: SCAC (Standard Carrier Alpha Code)
value.desc: Directory of standard multimodal carriers and tariff agent codes. The SCAC lists and codes transportation companies.

value.name: ECA (Electronic Commerce Australia)
value.desc: Australian association for electronic commerce.

value.name: TELEBOX 400 (Deutsche Telekom)

value.name: Statens Teleforvaltning
value.desc: Norwegian telecommunications regulatory authority (NTRA).

value.desc: Swiss Chamber of Commerce.

value.name: SITA (Societe Internationale de Telecommunications

value.name: Assigned by seller or seller's agent
value.desc: Self explanatory.

value.name: Assigned by buyer or buyer's agent
value.desc: Self explanatory.

value.name: TW, Trade-van
value.desc: Trade-van is an EDI VAN service center for customs, transport, and insurance in national and international trade.

value.name: BNCR (Telekurs Banken Clearing Number)
value.desc: Swiss national bank number assigned by Telekurs AG for the purpose of identifying a non-clearing banking institution.

value.name: BPI (Telekurs Business Partner Identification)
value.desc: Swiss national business number assigned by Telekurs AG for the purpose of identifying a non-clearing banking institution.

value.name: Mutually defined
value.desc: Self explanatory.

element.name: Address for reverse routing
element.desc: Address for reverse routing

element.name: Recipient Identification
element.desc: Code or name as specified in IA

element.name: Routing address
element.desc: If used, normally coded sub-address for onward routing

value.name: Data element error indication
value.desc: To identify an erroneous simple, composite or component data element, and to identify the nature of the error.

value.name: Functional group response
value.desc: To identify a functional group in the subject interchange and to indicate acknowledgement or rejection (action taken) of the UNG and UNE segments, and to identify any error related to these segments. Depending on the action code, it may also indicate the action taken on the messages within that functional group.

value.name: Interchange response
value.desc: To identify the subject interchange, to indicate interchange receipt, to indicate acknowledgement or rejection (action taken) of the UNA, UNB and UNZ segments, and to identify any error related to these segments. Depending on the action code, it may also indicate the action taken on the functional groups and messages within that interchange.

value.name: Message response
value.desc: To identify a message in the subject interchange, and to indicate that message's acknowledgement or rejection (action taken), and to identify any error related to the UNH and UNT segments.

value.name: Segment error indication
value.desc: To identify either a segment containing an error or a missing segment, and to identify any error related to the complete segment.

value.name: Service string advice
value.desc: To define the characters selected for use as delimiters and indicators in the rest of the interchange that follows.

value.name: Interchange header
value.desc: To start, identify and specify an interchange.

value.name: Functional group trailer
value.desc: To end and check the completeness of a functional group.

value.name: Functional group header
value.desc: To head, identify and specify a functional group.

value.name: Message header
value.desc: To head, identify and specify a message.

value.name: Section control
value.desc: To separate header, detail and summary sections of a message.

value.name: Message trailer
value.desc: To end and check the completeness of a message.

value.name: Interchange trailer
value.desc: To end and check the completeness of an interchange.

element.name: Interchange control reference
element.desc: Unique reference assigned by sender

element.name: Recipient's reference/password
element.desc: As specified in IA. May be password to recipient's system or to third party network

element.name: Recipient's reference/password qualifier
element.desc: If specified in IA

value.name: Reference
value.desc: Self explanatory.

value.name: Password
value.desc: Self explanatory.

element.name: Application reference
element.desc: Optionally message identification if the interchange contains only one type of message

element.name: Processing priority code
element.desc: Used if specified in IA

value.name: Highest priority
value.desc: Self explanatory.

element.name: Acknowledgement request
element.desc: Set = 1 if sender requests acknowledgement, i.e. UNB and UNZ segments received and identified

value.name: Requested
value.desc: Acknowledgement is requested.

element.name: Communications agreement id
element.desc: If used, to identify type of communication agreement controlling the interchange, e.g. Customs or ECE agreement. Code or name as specified in IA

element.name: Test indicator
element.desc: Set = 1 if the interchange is a test. Otherwise not used

value.name: Interchange is a test
value.desc: Self explanatory.

element.name: Interchange control count
element.desc: The count of the number of messages or, if used, the number of functional groups in the interchange. One of these counts shall appear.

element.name: Functional group identification
element.desc: Identifies the one message type in the functional group

element.name: Application sender's identification
element.desc: Code or name identifying the division, department etc. within the originating sender's organization

element.name: Recipient's identification
element.desc: Code or name identifying the division,department etc. within the recipients organization for which the group of messages is intended

element.name: Functional group reference number
element.desc: Unique reference number assigned by sender's division, department etc.

element.name: Controlling agency
element.desc: Code to identify the agency controlling the specification, maintenance and publication of the message type

value.name: RINET (Reinsurance and Insurance Network)

value.desc: Self explanatory.

value.desc: United Nations Economic UN Economic Commission for Europe (UN/ECE), Committee on the development of trade (TRADE), Working Party on facilitation of international trade procedures (WP.4).

element.name: Message version number
element.desc: Version number of the message type in the functional group

value.name: Status 1 version
value.desc: Message approved and issued as a status 1 (trial) message. (Valid for directories published after March 1990 and prior to March 1993).

value.name: Status 2 version
value.desc: Message approved and issued as a status 2 (formal recommendation) message. (Valid for directories published after March 1990 and prior to March 1993).

value.name: 1988 version
value.desc: Message approved and issued in the 1988 release of the UNTDID (United Nations Trade Data Interchange Directory) as a status 2 (formal recommendation) message.

value.name: 1989 version
value.desc: Message approved and issued in the 1989 release of the UNTDID (United Nations Trade Data Interchange Directory) as a status 2 (formal recommendation) message.

value.name: 1990 version
value.desc: Message approved and issued in the 1990 release of the UNTDID (United Nations Trade Data Interchange Directory) as a status 2 (formal recommendation) message.

value.name: Draft version/UN/EDIFACT Directory
value.desc: Message approved and issued as a draft message (Valid for directories published after March 1993 and prior to March 1997). Message approved as a standard message (Valid for directories published after March 1997).

value.name: Standard version
value.desc: Message approved and issued as a standard message. (Valid for directories published after March 1993 and prior to March 1997).

element.name: Message release number
element.desc: Release number within current version number

value.name: First release
value.desc: Message approved and issued in the first release of the year of the UNTDID (United Nations Trade Data Interchange Directory). (Valid for directories published prior to March 1990)

value.name: Second release
value.desc: Message approved and issued in the second release of the year of the UNTDID (United Nations Trade Data Interchange Directory) (Valid for directories published prior to March 1990).

value.name: Trial release 1990
value.desc: Message approved and issued in the 1990 status 1 (trial) release of the UNTDID (United Nations Trade Data Interchange Directory).

value.name: Trial release 1991
value.desc: Message approved and issued in the 1991 status 1 (trial) release of the UNTDID (United Nations Trade Data Interchange Directory).

value.name: Standard release 1991
value.desc: Message approved and issued in the 1991 status 2 (standard) release of the UNTDID (United Nations Trade Data Interchange Directory).

value.name: Trial release 1992
value.desc: Message approved and issued in the 1992 status 1 (trial) release of the UNTDID (United Nations Trade Data Interchange Directory).

value.name: Standard release 1993
value.desc: Message approved and issued in the 1993 status 2 (standard) release of the UNTDID (United Nations Trade Data Interchange Directory).

value.name: Release 1993 - A
value.desc: Message approved and issued in the 1993 release of the UNTDID (United Nations Trade Data Interchange Directory).

value.name: Release 1994 - A
value.desc: Message approved and issued in the first 1994 release of the UNTDID (United Nations Trade Data Interchange Directory).

value.name: Release 1994 - B
value.desc: Message approved and issued in the second 1994 release of the UNTDID (United Nations Trade Data Interchange Directory).

value.name: Release 1995 - A
value.desc: Message approved and issued in the first 1995 release of the UNTDID (United Nations Trade Data Interchange Directory).

value.name: Release 1995 - B
value.desc: Message approved and issued in the second 1995 release of the UNTDID (United Nations Trade Data Interchange Directory).

value.name: Release 1996 - A
value.desc: Message approved and issued in the first 1996 release of the UNTDID (United Nations Trade Data Interchange Directory).

value.name: Release 1996 - B
value.desc: Message approved and issued in the second 1996 release of the UNTDID (United Nations Trade Data Interchange Directory).

value.name: Release 1997 - A
value.desc: Message approved and issued in the first 1997 release of the UNTDID (United Nations Trade Data Interchange Directory).

value.name: Release 1997 - B
value.desc: Message approved and issued in the second 1997 release of the UNTDID (United Nations Trade Data Interchange Directory).

value.name: Release 1998 - A
value.desc: Message approved and issued in the first 1998 release of the UNTDID (United Nations Trade Data Interchange Directory).

value.name: Release 1998 - B
value.desc: Message approved and issued in the second 1998 release of the UNTDID (United Nations Trade Data Interchange Directory).

value.name: Release 1999 - A
value.desc: Message approved and issued in the first 1999 release of the UNTDID (United Nations Trade Data Interchange Directory).

element.name: Common access reference
element.desc: Key to relate all subsequent transfers of data to the same business case of file. Within the 35 characters the IA may specify component elements

element.name: Sequence of transfers
element.desc: Starts at 1 and is incremented by 1 for each transfer

element.name: First and last transfer
element.desc: C = Creation, must be present for first transfer if more than one foreseen, F = Final, must be present for last transfer

value.name: Creation
value.desc: First transmission of a number of transfers of the same message.

value.name: Final
value.desc: Last transmission of a number of transfers of the same message.

element.name: Number of segments in the message
element.desc: Control count including UNH and UNT

element.name: Text reference code
element.desc: Qualifies and identifies the purpose and function of the segment if indicated in the message specification

element.name: Free form text
element.desc: Not machine-processable information

element.name: Section identification
element.desc: Separates sections in a message by one of the following codes: D separates the header and detail sections S separates the detail and summary sections

value.name: Header/detail section separation
value.desc: To qualify the segment UNS, when separating the header from the detail section of a message.

value.name: Detail/summary section separation
value.desc: To qualify the segment UNS, when separating the detail from the summary section of a message.

value.name: Acknowledged (this level and all lower levels)
value.desc: Self explanatory.

value.name: Acknowledged - errors detected and reported
value.desc: Self explanatory.

value.name: One or more rejected - next lower level
value.desc: Self explanatory.

value.name: This level and all lower levels rejected
value.desc: The corresponding referenced-level and all its lower referenced-levels are rejected. One or more errors are reported at this reporting-level or a lower reporting- level.

value.name: UNB/UNZ accepted
value.desc: Self explanatory.

value.name: UNB/UNZ rejected
value.desc: Self explanatory.

value.name: This level acknowledged, next lower level acknowledged if
value.desc: not explicitly rejected The corresponding referenced-level is acknowledged. All messages or functional groups at the next lower referenced-level are acknowledged except those explicitly reported as rejected at the next lower reporting-level in this CONTRL message.

value.name: Interchange received
value.desc: Indication of interchange receipt implies that the recipient of the subject interchange: has received the interchange; and acknowledges the parts of the interchange that have been checked in order to assure that the data elements copied into the reporting UCI segment are syntactically correct; and has accepted liability for notifying the sender of acknowledgement or rejection of the other parts of the interchange; and has taken reasonable precautions in order to ensure that the sender is so notified.

value.name: UNA not supported
value.desc: Notification that the UNA character string cannot be understood or complied with.

value.name: Syntax version or level not supported
value.desc: Notification that the syntax version and/or level is not supported by the recipient.

value.name: Message version/release not supported
value.desc: Notification that the message type, version number and/or release number in the UNG and/or UNH segments are not supported by the recipient.

value.name: Service segment missing/invalid
value.desc: Notification that a service segment is missing, contains invalid data or cannot be processed for any reason.

value.name: Trailer check in error
value.desc: Notification that data contained in the trailer does not agree with data in the header and/or that the functional group or message or segment count is incorrect.

value.name: Data segment missing/invalid
value.desc: Notification that a data segment is missing, contains invalid data or cannot be processed for any reason.

value.name: Interchange recipient not actual recipient
value.desc: Notification that the Interchange recipient (S003) is different from the actual recipient.

value.name: Too many data elements in segment
value.desc: Indication that a data segment contains too many data elements.

value.name: Mandatory data element missing
value.desc: Indication that a mandatory data element is missing in a service or data segment.

value.name: Data element attribute error
value.desc: Indication that a data element does not conform to the relevant message or segment specification.

value.name: Password invalid
value.desc: Indication that the password in segment UNB is invalid.

value.name: Invalid value
value.desc: Notification that the value of a simple data element, composite data element or component data element does not conform to the relevant specifications for the value.

value.name: Missing
value.desc: Notification that a mandatory (or otherwise required) service or user segment, data element, composite data element or component data element is missing

value.name: Value not supported in this position
value.desc: Notification that the recipient does not support use of the specific value of an identified simple data element, composite data element or component data element in the position where it is used. The value may be valid according to the relevant specifications and may be supported if it is used in another position.

value.name: Not supported in this position
value.desc: Notification that the recipient does not support use of the segment type, simple data element type, composite data element type or component data element type in the specific in the identified position.

value.name: Too many constituents
value.desc: Notification that the identified segment contained to many data elements or that the identified composite data element contained too many component data elements.

value.name: No agreement
value.desc: No agreement exist that allows receipt of an interchange, functional group or message with the value of the identified simple data element, composite data element or component data element.

value.name: Unspecified error
value.desc: Notification that an error has been identified, but the nature of the error is not reported.

value.name: Invalid decimal notation
value.desc: Notification that the character indicated as decimal notation in UNA is invalid, or the decimal notation used in a data element is not consistent with the one indicated in UNA.

value.name: Character invalid as service character
value.desc: Notification that a character advised in UNA is invalid as service character.

value.name: Invalid character(s)
value.desc: Notification that one or more character(s) used in the interchange is not a valid character as defined by the syntax level indicated in UNB. The invalid character is part of the referenced-level, or followed immediately after the identified part of the interchange.

value.name: Invalid service character(s)
value.desc: Notification that the service character(s) used in the interchange is not a valid service character as advised in UNA or not one of the service characters in the syntax level indicated in UNB or defined in an interchange agreement. If the code is used in UCS or UCD, the invalid character followed immediately after the identified part of the interchange.

value.name: Unknown Interchange sender
value.desc: Notification that the Interchange sender (S002) is unknown.

value.name: Too old
value.desc: Notification that the received interchange or functional group is older than a limit specified in an IA or determined by the recipient.

value.name: Test indicator not supported
value.desc: Notification that a test processing could not be performed for the identified interchange, functional group or message.

value.name: Duplicate detected
value.desc: Notification that a possible duplication of a previously received interchange, functional group or message has been detected. The earlier transmission may have been rejected.

value.name: Security function not supported
value.desc: Notification that a security function related to the referenced-level or data element is not supported.

value.name: References do not match
value.desc: Notification that the control reference in UNB/UNG/UNH does not match the one in UNZ/UNE/UNT.

value.name: Control count does not match number of instances received
value.desc: Notification that the number of functional groups/ messages/segments does not match the number given in UNZ/UNE/UNT.

value.name: Functional groups and messages mixed
value.desc: Notification that individual messages and functional groups have been mixed at the same level in the interchange.

value.name: More than one message type in group
value.desc: Notification that different message types are contained in a functional group.

value.name: Lower level empty
value.desc: Notification that the interchange did not contain any messages or functional groups, or a functional group did not contain any messages.

value.name: Invalid occurrence outside message or functional group
value.desc: Notification that an invalid segment or data element occurred in the interchange, between messages or between functional groups. Rejection is reported at the level above.

value.name: Nesting indicator not allowed
value.desc: Notification that explicit nesting has been used in a message where it shall not be used.

value.name: Too many segment repetitions
value.desc: Notification that a segment was repeated too many times.

value.name: Too many segment group repetitions
value.desc: Notification that a segment group is repeated to many times.

value.name: Invalid type of character(s)
value.desc: Notification that one or more numeric characters were used in an alphabetic (component) data element or that one or more alphabetic characters were used in a numeric (component) data element.

value.name: Missing digit in front of decimal sign
value.desc: Notification that a decimal sign is not preceded by one or more digits.

value.name: Data element too long
value.desc: Notification that the length of the data element received exceeded the maximum length specified in the data element description.

value.name: Data element too short
value.desc: Notification that the length of the data element received is shorter than the minimum length specified in the data element description.

value.name: Permanent communication network error
value.desc: Notification that a permanent error was reported by the communication network used for transfer of the interchange. Re-transmission of an identical interchange with the same parameters at network level will not succeed.

value.name: Temporary communication network error
value.desc: Notification that a temporary error was reported by the communication network used for transfer of the interchange. Re-transmissions of an identical interchange may succeed.

value.name: Unknown interchange recipient
value.desc: Notification that the interchange recipient is not known by a network provider.

value.name: Application temporarily unavailable
value.desc: Notification that traffic for an application is inhibited.

segment.name: Interchange Header
segment.desc: To start, identify and specify an interchange

segment.name: Interchange Trailer
segment.desc: To end and check the completeness of an interchange

segment.name: Functional Group Header
segment.desc: To head, identify and specify a Functional Group

segment.name: Functional Group Trailer
segment.desc: To end and check the completeness of a Functional Group

segment.name: Message Header
segment.desc: To head, identify and specify a Message

segment.name: Message Trailer
segment.desc: To end and check the completeness of a Message

segment.name: Text
segment.desc: To give information in addition to that in other segments in the service message, as required

segment.name: Section Control
segment.desc: To separate Header, Detail and Summary sections of a message
